patterns: What is Lumpy Skin Disease?

responses: Lumpy Skin Disease (LSD) is a viral disease that affects cattle, causing skin nodules, fever, and reduced milk production. It is spread through insects like mosquitoes and ticks.
Lumpy disease is caused by the Lumpy Skin Disease Virus (LSDV), a member of the Poxviridae family, and spreads mainly through insect bites.
There is no specific cure for Lumpy Skin Disease, but supportive care includes anti-inflammatory drugs, antibiotics for secondary infections, and vaccination to prevent outbreaks.
